means: 喘气，喘息( pant的第三人称单数 )

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"裤子"之意。
means: jeans ： 指劳动布裤或牛仔裤。
pants ： 常用词，在美国，泛指各类裤子，在英国指衬裤或短裤。
slacks ： 美国指比较宽松的便裤，英国人指妇女外面穿的长裤。
trousers ： 指长裤，用于较正式场合。

sentence.Network_en: He put on a pair of short pants and an undershirt.
sentence.Network_cn: 他穿上了一条短裤和一件汗衫。

sentence.Network_en: They knock around on weekends in grubby sweaters and pants.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们周末穿着邋遢的毛衫和裤子到处闲逛。

sentence.Network_en: He was wearing cotton pants and an open-necked shirt.
sentence.Network_cn: 他穿着纯棉裤子和开领衬衫。

phrase.cizu_name: catch someone with their pants (或trousers) down

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)catch someone in an embarrassingly unprepared state
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)在某人尴尬不备时逮个正着

phrase.cizu_name: fly (或drive) by the seat of one's pants

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)rely on instinct rather than logic or knowledge

phrase.cizu_name: scare (或 bore etc.) the pants off someone

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)把某人吓得魂不附体（或使某人感到特别乏味）

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: abbreviation of pantaloons (see pantaloon)

entry.def: Pants are a piece of underwear which have two holes to put your legs through and elastic around the top to hold them up round your waist or hips.

example.ex: I put on my bra and pants.

entry.def: Pants are a piece of clothing that covers the lower part of your body and each leg.

example.ex: He wore brown corduroy pants and a white cotton shirt.
example.tran: 他身着棕色灯芯绒裤子和白色棉衬衫。

entry.def: If you say that something is pants, you mean that it is very poor in quality.

example.ex: The place is pants, yet so popular.
example.tran: 那个地方很糟糕，却很受欢迎。

entry.tran: 使…（烦）得要死；把…（吓）得要命
entry.def: If someone bores, charms, or scares the pants off you, for example, they bore, charm, or scare you a lot.

example.ex: You'll bore the pants off your grandchildren...
We all love to frighten the pants off ourselves by going on hair-raising rides at funfairs.
example.tran: 我们都喜欢乘坐游乐场那些让人毛发直竖的游乐设施，把自己吓得魂不附体。

entry.def: If you fly by the seat of your pants or do something by the seat of your pants, you use your instincts to tell you what to do in a new or difficult situation rather than following a plan or relying on equipment.

means.word_mean: 1. (usually in the plural) a garment extending from the waist to the knee or ankle, covering each leg separately;

sentences.sentence: "he had a sharp crease in his trousers"

means.word_mean: 2. (usually in the plural) underpants worn by women;

sentences.sentence: "she was afraid that her bloomers might have been showing"

example.en: Michael was shitting in his pants.
example.zh: 迈克尔当时吓得屁滚尿流。

example.en: The piano lid fell and scared the pants off my parents.
example.zh: 钢琴盖突然倒了下来，把我的爹妈吓了一大跳。

list.explanation: (伐木工、捕鱼人等穿的)防水帆布裤

example.en: toggers and fishermen certainly wear the tin pants while they do their working.
example.zh: 伐木工人和渔夫作业时必定是穿着防水帆布裤的。

example.en: His hot pants will get him in trouble.
example.zh: 他的好色将来会让他吃苦头的。

example.en: Catherine the Great was apparently an imperal hot pants.
example.zh: 叶卡捷琳娜一世显然是个风流女皇。

Sentence.sentence: If we ask Americans why they eat with knives and forks, or why their men wear pants instead of skirts, or why they may be married to only one person at a time, we are likely to get similar and very uninformative answers: "Because it's right.
Would you like to see those pants in brown and navy blue?
Grey pants made from pure cotton
Do you think you'll be able to get this ink stain out of my pants?
Cleaning the pants will take longer than usual
